formattedAddress: 310 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 310 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Stylish bar in the SoHo Grand Hotel draws a well-heeled set for cocktails, noshes & weekend DJs.

originalText.text:
As a guest of the hotel, the convenience is unmatched. We had breakfast as well as evening drinks in the bar area. The breakfast was delicious and well-portioned. The evening drinks were OK, but service was seriously lacking. I ordered a vodka with lemonade and the drink that showed up certainly had some additional ingredients‚Äîseltzer at the very least. I also wasn‚Äôt provided a straw and my partner had to walk over to ask the bartender to which they simply said ‚Äúok‚Äù in an annoyed tone.
We wanted additional drinks but the server never came back!

originalText.text:
I had dinner here and my dish was delicious.
I think this best pasta i eaten for last 3 years.  Crab Fetuchini. My friend order steack and its also was very good.  Plate of cheese can be served little bit more beautiful  as its was. Nowdays add cuple of barries wont be a big deal i guess but will looks betrer.  its was served with green hard apple. Any way i can say bravo to master who cooked my pasta. Amazing üòç

originalText.text:
The food was delivered to the table with one meal missing. They said it would be 10 minutes more. When they finally delivered the food (more then 10 minutes later) it was cooked but they made a mess of the chicken. It was fried not roasted and they had cut up the chicken to reduce the cooking time. I was offered a salad while I waited, which they charged me for. It was too salty, and so wet with dressing it weighed down the salad leaves.
My friend‚Äôs club sandwich was a mess of dry bread that couldn‚Äôt hold the sandwich and was poorly built. It had so much filling it spilled out all over the plate. Oh, and the fries were limp and over seasoned.
It seemed like the waiter didn‚Äôt inform the ma√Ætre d‚Äôh√¥tel about the issues‚Ä¶
Think twice before you spend your hard earned money here.

originalText.text: Beautiful place with decent drinks. Received great service too including the staff downstairs who were so welcoming. There was a fashion event happening but they managed the guests well. I think it‚Äôs become that place that influencers frequent but if that doesn‚Äôt bother you, then come for the vibe and dog-spotting.

originalText.text:
This place used to be fun when it was the place to be years ago but apparently it definitely no longer is and has not been for some time. Service is barely existent the past few times i have gone for drinks and tapas during peak and non-peak times. Yesterday i had a very important first date and a reservation (Sunday PM) and after 90 min i was asked to leave my reserved table (never told i only had 90 min to eat and leave) and move to the bar. Totally ridiculous when there was about 10 other open tables even tho apparently they were "reserved" for other people per the manager.  Dont waste your money here. Drinks are no longer great anyway. The hotel clients are really the only ones that benefit from the convenience of this hotel bar now. Probably just another post-COVID change in quality to the entire place like a lot of places in NYC.

20NOV2023 UPDATE: Returned to Soho Grand with a dear friend. Host made some excuse about there being no tables available in salon yet didn't say I could wait for an open table if I wanted. She said seat yourself at the bar. We did. Nobody at the bar asked for our order. Then I had to ask an idiotic arrogant waiter who was pissed the host didn't inform him of our presence. This place needs to get their sh!t together. It's totally dysfunctional and the whole experience sucks. I'm still going but nobody will be getting any tips from me. You need to FIRE EVERYONE. It's pathetic.
